title: Srimad Bhagavatam 2.9.31 Lecture by HG Stoka Krishna Prabhu
speaker: HG Madhu Pandit Dasa

segments.text: So in the Purpose of Rampal, he is describing something about each of these personal attributes of the Lord.
In this paragraph that I just now read, he is discussing or describing the transcendental form of the bodies of the Lord.
He is an unlimited person, so he has unlimited forms.
But all the forms are identical with one another.
This is difficult for us to conceive, that there is one person with many forms, all simultaneously existing and all identical with each other.
The same person, but he is present as Rama, Narasimha, Varaha, Krishna, Matsya.
All identical, one Supreme Lord, but he is present in many different forms.
This is actually an opulence of the Lord, that you cannot limit him to just one form.
Neither he becomes split personality when he expands or when he is present in many forms.
He is still the same person, still the same Supreme Lord.
His qualities or his activities or his powers do not reduce when he expands, when he is present in many forms.
And these forms are not temporary forms, they are all eternal forms.
So we cannot understand, in our present condition, what is the actual nature of this form of God.
So what we should do is, we should simply hear on the authority of the Sriman Bhagavatam, on the authority of the great devotees, on the authority of the Acharya, Srila Prabhupada, to simply hear.
And while hearing, we try to keep aside all our material conceptions.
Material conceptions of the form means, a form is a limitation.
Transcendental form means there is no limitation.
So the form actually has got unlimited power, unlimited varieties, unlimited love, unlimited qualities.
But still, the form is something which, when it is revealed, it becomes known to the devotee and it may appear like an ordinary form.
Just like the form of Krishna.
Now Krishna appears in Vrindavan like a cowherd boy.
So, people may think, is this a form of God?
Even big big devatas, including Brahma, they will doubt whether this is the form of God or it is the form of somebody else.
So Brahma knew that actually that form of Krishna as cowherd boy is actually God's form.
But still he wanted to test.
Brahma's mystic power is among the greatest in this material world.
So Brahma used his mystic power.
What is the power of Brahma's mystic power?
Any example you can think of?
Brahma demonstrates his mystic power sometimes.
No example you can think of.
Of course, while testing Krishna, he used his mystic power.
When Hiranyakashik was doing tapasya, what did Brahma come and do?
Hiranyakashik's body was eaten away by ants.
The skin, the flesh, everything was finished.
Just he sprinkled some water and Hiranyakashik's body became fully reconstructed.
So that is Brahma's mystic power.
So Brahma gave Hiranyakashik to the boon that you will not die in the day or night.
You cannot be killed by human.
You cannot be killed by human.
You cannot be killed by devata.
You cannot be killed by asura.
You cannot be killed by any insect or reptile or animal.
So Hiranyakashik became very, very, very, very powerful.
So that is Brahma's mystic power.
That Brahma is trying to see who is his covered body.
Trying to test who is his covered body.
What did Brahma do to test Krishna?
First he took away the karmas.
Which Krishna had brought for grazing.
Along with the karmas he also brought karmas for grazing.
And they were a big number.
Number is not mentioned in the Bhagavad Gita.
They were a very big number.
In Jetani Jetanatha I have made an idea of number.
So Brahma used his mystic power.
And while Krishna was enjoying his lunch with the other covered boys,
that time Brahma took away the karmas.
And suddenly one of the covered boys is seeing,
Oh, the karmas are not there.
So Krishna knows what is happening.
But just to play along with Brahma,
Krishna said, told the covered boys,
I will just go look around and bring them back.
Looking for some fresh grass here and there.
Meantime, when Krishna had gone away,
and took away the covered boys.
He put those karmas into a sleeping condition
Next he put the boys into a sleeping condition
and coming back and seeing what is happening.
So you can imagine how powerful is Brahma.
He can put them to sleep and hide them
He is coming back and seeing
all the covered boys and the karmas
are as they are in Krishna.
So Brahma is giving them away.
He is using his mystic power
And he is trying to see
whether the covered boys and karmas
are the same or they are different.
And Brahma is seeing they are
from where Brahma had hidden them.
Two sets of covered boys and karmas.
And here Krishna is also hiding.
up to nine or ten forms.
And all forms will look identical
if in one form he lifts his hand
all the forms will be doing
that this cowherd boy is displaying.
It's not possible even for me.
One of the forms of Krishna
because the universe is so big.
How can you see the whole universe
and he is the same person
this form is an unlimited form.
even if you see God's form
But this is not a statue.
It is not an ordinary form.
So if you also want to
There is a certain amount of
we try to please a person.
What does the child do whole day?
How long I have to do this.
Simply by speaking it is said he realized Brahma.
I think Shri Krishna Goswami realized Brahma before.
But still, he attained perfection by speaking.
The Bhagavad Gita, the Parishad Maharaj has.
Who is famous for having realized Krishna by remembering?
Prahlad Maharaj, simply by remembering he realized God.
Then, serving the Lotus Feet, Lakshmi.
Lakshmi is always engaged in serving the Lotus Feet of the Supreme God.
But her realization of God came about by the same method, same process.
Serving the Lotus Feet of the Lord with devotion.
Who realized God by offering prayers?
Simply he offered prayers to Krishna.
Simply by acting as the Lord's servant.
Lord Ram is known as servant.
There are so many Masters who are servants.
But that type of servant is not going to help you.
Because they are not rendering service.
They are not rendering service with devotion.
In this world, so many Masters and so many servants.
Some of them say, oh, very faithful servant.
But still, it is not having devotion.
So with devotion, how to serve?
As a servant of the Lord, of Krishna, the Supreme Lord.
That you have to learn from Hanuman.
You have to learn from Parishad.
How to serve the lotus feet?
You have to learn from Prajnini.
So like this, Bhagavatam process especially is expressed in the Bhagavatam.
All the things here is the easiest.
Other things are not so easy.
Remembering, serving the lotus feet, acting as the servant of the Lord like Hanuman did.
The special thing about hearing is, it doesn't require any qualification.
You have to speak, or you have to serve the lotus feet, or you have to remember.
Whereas hearing is the only thing among the nine processes that does not require any qualification.
But there is a quality to the hearing.
And for that Bhagavatam says, even the technique of hearing, you develop by hearing only.
Simply sit and hear, that's all.
In the early days, Prabhupada was travelling.
You forgot to put in the belt.
I'll come close with this example.
Prabhupada was travelling with some disciples.
Because the temple had not yet been started.
So Prabhupada told the disciples, some few devotees,
You simply hear, I will recite the tenth canto of the Bhagavatam,
which describes specially the birth of Krishna.
Because today is the Janmashtami, the birthday of Krishna,
Prabhupada said, whether you understand or don't understand,
simply by hearing, you get full spiritual benefit.
So, hearing doesn't require any qualification.
You simply have to lend your ear.
And whether you understand or don't understand,
And, in the beginning, maybe you don't understand.
But as you go on hearing, hearing, hearing, hearing, hearing,
It's just a question of time.
But, there is a warning given in the Bhagavatam.
Don't try to conceive within your material mind what is being described.
Just like if it is described, Krishna is black complexion, dark complexion.
Immediately, material world conception of dark is not beautiful.
Material world, somebody's dark complexion, we say, generally, not beautiful.
But, spiritual conception of beauty is different.
It is not dependent on the color of the skin or the complexion of the body.
As Prabhupada says here, some of the forms are blackish, some are whitish, some are reddish, some are yellowish.
All of them are supremely beautiful.
It has no relationship with beauty.
Beautiful certain complexion is same, not beautiful.
Spiritually, there is no such thing as not beautiful.
So, you should not speculate about the spiritual subject matter or what is being described.
And try to perceive this knowledge or hear without trying to conceive, without trying to speculate, without trying to guess, without trying to think what it could be like that we imagine.
Now, the moment you hear something, you compare materially what it could be.
So, this sort of hearing will actually help you to realize.
Nidra Ashrama Bhagavad Gita, Nidra Ashrama Prabhupada.
